medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute abdominal pain localized to the RUQ.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Pain started last night at midnight, initially in the whole right side of the abdomen, then localized to the RUQ. Denies any nausea, vomiting, fevers or chills. Last bowel movement was this morning; patient has been passing flatus.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Perforated bowel, HCV, migraines, chronic low back pain, anxiety/depression, CBD stones, cholelithiasis, history of sphincterotomy complicated by duodenal perforation.
medical_history.family_history: Mother and sister with symptomatic cholelithiasis requiring CCY. Father died from myocardial infarction.
